response.answer_text: Joe Biden wasn’t my pick in the primary. He wasn’t my last choice - at least not until the field was whittled down to the last few - but as a lifelong independent, I’ve honestly never really had my pick. That said, I’ve been saying it for months and months: if they Dems nominate a genital wart, then I’ll be all about President Genital Wart, 2020. As an amateur historian my entire adult life, and an enormous fan of our founding fathers - especially the group I consider the original three, Ben Franklin, John Adams and Thomas Jefferson (in that order) - the more I learned about the founding of our country, the more impressed by it I’ve been. Despite the glaring oversight (to say the least) of slavery, the step our founding fathers took to take the entire world out of feudalism was monumental. And yet, what McConnell and the rest of the GOP has done to our country in just a few short years made it psychically and spiritually impossible for me to live another day in the United States. After years of trying, my wife and I finally made it to New Zealand on Christmas Day 2019 - barely escaping the sheer and utter incompetence of the Trump administration’s handling of the COVID nightmare. I’ve never been a fan of Trump, but my issue with him has always been his incompetence. Yeah, he’s petty and small and seems negligently indifferent to people who are not Donald Trump, but it’s his complete inability to get anything of substance done that I have issue with. But let’s be honest, normally the presidency doesn’t really have much lasting power. I mean sure they can get us into wars and waste trillions of dollars, but they can’t write law. What they’re essentially supposed to be is on the one hand a spiritual and emotional leader for the citizenry and on the other a national manager - a person to oversee the cabinet whose job it is to enforce the laws that the Article One branch passes and the Article Three branch (in essence) validates. A POTUS is supposed to be the person at the heart of the administrative storm who can multi-task like a mofo and ensure that all those laws and legal precedents are being enforced. Yeah, that’s why too much work for a single person, of course, so they’re supposed to hire the next level of super bad-ass administrative geniuses to in turn hire the next tier of administrative bad-asses, and that’s the Executive Branch - the branch of the government that’s just supposed to keep it all working. Of course the GOP calls all of these people “the Deep State,” so … Anyway, in light of all that, truly ask yourself - do you really want another four years of this? Trump would kill his own grandmother if it’d get him a few more minutes on the ole TeeVee, but do you honestly think he cares even the tiniest bit about whether HUD or the FCC or the IRS are doing anything, but help him and his rich trillionaire homies? Biden might not be the bee’s knees, but do you think he at least has the ability, the wherewithal and the inclination to hire the administrators we sorely need to put the US back together?
